data.title: 35th Sultan of Perak: Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah Ibni Almarhum Sultan Azlan Muhibbuddin Shah Al-Maghfurlah (2014 – present)
data.meta_description: Sultan Nazrin Muizzudin Shah is the eldest son of the 34th Sultan of Perak, Sultan Azlan Muhibbuddin Shah ibni Almarhum Sultan Yussuf Izzudin Shah (1984-2014). He was born in Penang on 27th November 1956. As a child, Sultan Nazrin Muizzudin Shah is a bright student and his academic qualifications are above excellence. He received his…
data.text:
As the head of Islamic religion in the state, Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah places greater emphasis in uplifting Islam. He believes that a Muslim nation is not one formed only by its namesake, but should also create a ruling system which practices good deeds and prevents wrongdoings. As the torchbearer of Islam, Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah believed in moderation. During the proclamation as the Sultan of Perak, Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah pledges to protect the good name and sanctity of Islam. Therefore, it is common to see mosque institution contributing to progress and development in Perak under his reign.

Sultan Nazrin Muizzudin Shah is known as a caring Ruler who takes a personal interest in the welfare and concerns of the state’s subjects. As Raja Muda and the Regent of Perak, he was actively involved in various charitable causes. In many of his royal addresses, he always expresses his concerns and thoughts in the area of economic and political development not only on Perak but the country as a whole.

Education is also a subject close to Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah’s heart. He takes a keen interest in the well-being of the people and supports any effort to improve the quality of the people through education. Given his passion towards academic development in the country, he has been Pro-Chancellor of University Malaya from 1989 and in 2014 as the Chancellor of Universiti Malaya. Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah is also the Chairman of the Board of Governors of the Malay College, Kuala Kangsar.

Besides that, he is a Member of the Chancellor’s Court of Benefactor, University of Oxford and Honorary Fellow of Worcester College, University of Oxford. He is a Member of the Board of Trustees of the Oxford Centre for Islamic Studies, University of Oxford, Royal Patron of the Kuala Lumpur Business. Sultan Nazrin Muizzuddin Shah is also an Eminent Fellow of the Institute of Strategic and International Studies, Malaysia; Royal Fellow of the Malaysian Institute of Defence and Security as well as the Chairman of Merdeka Award.

After completing her A-Levels at Prime College in 1992, Tuanku Zara Salim left for the United Kingdom to pursue her studies in chemical engineering at the University of Nottingham. She graduated with first class honours in July 1995. She also won the top student award for her final year project.

Upon completion of her studies, Tuanku Zara Salim was employed by Petronas. Her career there started at the Business Evaluation Department, Corporate Planning Unit. During her 6 years tenure with the national oil company, her contributions were enormous. Tuanku Zara Salim is also a certified life-saver and adventure sports enthusiast.
